section.name: What can i do with it?
section.p: This toolkit was developped to help developpers to integrate existing web applications and make them visible to the users as a single website.
This way of agregating contents extracted from other web sites is usually called web scraping .

section.name: Taglib
section.p: The Website Assembling Toolkit offers a taglib that can be used in any JSP-based java web application.

Basically, the taglib looks like Tiles tag library except that it enables you to include contents and use templates coming from other applications that may have been written using any technology en deployed on other servers.

section.name: Reverse proxy
section.p: The Website Assembling Toolkit can also be used as a reverse proxy. Proxied pages are parsed in order to process inclusion instructions that the applications insert.
It is similar to an ESI processor that would process ESI tags inside the pages. Future plans include ESI tags support but for now we use proprietary tags.

section.name: Other uses
section.p: Any functionality used by the taglib or the reverse proxy can be used through a simple API.

section.name: How does it work?
section.p: HTML pages are fetched from the provider server using regular HTTP requests. Pages are then parsed to find specific delimiters used to define the blocks. The blocks are then agregated and sent to the browser as a single HTML page.
